unlimited.fc.client.api
Interface UploadAppletLiveConnect

public interface UploadAppletLiveConnect

Title: FileCatalyst Upload Applet LiveConnect API Spec

Description: The following methods are available via JavaScript

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2012

Company: Unlimi-Tech Software Inc.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Chris Bailey

Method Detail

browseLive

java.lang.String browseLive(boolean addToQueue)
Select a file path.

Parameters:
addToQueue - value can be set so that the file/directory selected is automatically added to the queue. Else, the method only returns a full file path.
Returns:
Returns the full path selected by the user. Null String ("") if user has cancelled.

browseLiveMultiple

java.lang.String browseLiveMultiple(boolean addToQueue,
                                    java.lang.String delimiter)
Select multiple files. Note: will not work on Mac OSX clients (file chooser on Apple do not have option for multiple file selection).

Parameters:
addToQueue - value can be set so that the files/directories selected are automatically added to the queue.
delimiter - delimiter used when returning the file list back. If the delimiter is left blank (ie: ""), it is assumed that only 1 file is requested.
Returns:
Returns the full path selected by the user delimited value (ie: "c:/temp/file1.txt,c:/temp/file2.txt,c:/temp/file3.txt"). Null String ("") if user has cancelled.

uploadLive

void uploadLive()
Instantiates upload. Files must have previously been added to the transfer queue.

void addFilesToQueue(java.lang.String files,
                     java.lang.String delimiter)
Adds the specified files to the transfer queue

Parameters:
files - String Delimited list of absolute file paths
delimiter - String Delimiter to use when parsing list of files

void clearQueue()
Clears the transfer queue

void setRemoteDir(java.lang.String newRemoteDir)
Sets the remote directory. Must be set before the applet has connected for the value to take effect.

Parameters:
newRemoteDir -

getQueueItemSelected

java.lang.String getQueueItemSelected()
Returns the list of files/directories currently selected in the queue (right pane). If there is no queue pane (GUI disabled), a "" string is returned.

Returns:
list of file names/directories separated by delimiter

java.lang.String getQueueItems()
Returns the list of files/directories currently in the queue (right pane).

Returns:
list of file names/directories separated by delimiter

Returns a recursive list of files/directories currently in the queue (right pane).

Returns:
a recursive list of file names/directories separated by delimiter

removeFileFromQueue

boolean removeFileFromQueue(java.lang.String item)
Removes the specified item from the queue.

Parameters:
item - to remove
Returns:
true if the item was removed, false if item was not present in the queue

getTotalQueueSize

long getTotalQueueSize()
Returns the total size of all items in the queue

Returns:
the total size of all items in the queue

getQueueItemSize

long getQueueItemSize(java.lang.String item)
Returns the size of the specified queue item. If the specified item is not in the queue -1 will be returned.

Parameters:
item - full path of item in the queue
Returns:
the size of the specified queue item or -1 if it is not in the queue

getQueueFileCount

int getQueueFileCount()
Returns the total number of files in the queue, including files in sub-directories

Returns:
the total number of files in the queue, including files in sub-directories

isCancelledStateCalledByPause

boolean isCancelledStateCalledByPause()
Pause and cancel share the same internal state (cancelled). This value allows you to determine a cancelled state was derrived from the user applying a pause button or a cancel button.

Returns:
if the current cancel state was called by pause action.

getTransferSizeBytes

long getTransferSizeBytes()
Returns the transfer size. Data is cumulative for all transfers done on the applet, and is not accurate until transfer is complete or cancelled. The data reflects the actual bytes transfered on the network, not the original tranfer size (if file was partially already there using incremental or resume)

Returns:
Size of transfer in bytes.

getTransferFullSizeBytes

long getTransferFullSizeBytes()
Returns the transfer size. Data is cumulative for all transfers done on the applet, and is not accurate until transfer is complete or cancelled. The data reflects the original size of the files transferred even when deltas are utilized.

Returns:
Size of transfer in bytes.

getTransferDurationSeconds

long getTransferDurationSeconds()
Returns the transfer duration time in seconds. Data is cumulative for all transfers done on the applet, and is not accurate until transfer is complete or cancelled.

Returns:
64 bit long, transfer duration time in seconds.

getTransferMode

java.lang.String getTransferMode()
Return the transfer mode selected for this transfer. Returns one of the following string values: - "FTP" for TCP transfers - "UDP" for UDP FileCatalyst transfers - "HTTP" for HTTP transfers via servlet - "UNKNOWN" Error condition -- protocol should never be unknown.

Returns:
String value of protocol

setServerHost

void setServerHost(java.lang.String address)
Allows the setting of the server host address via Javascript. Must be a hostname or an IP address.

Parameters:
address - Hostname or IP Address

setServerPort

void setServerPort(int port)
Allows the setting of the server port.

Parameters:
port - Must be a valid port number (1-65536)

setUserName

void setUserName(java.lang.String username)
Sets the username for the connection to be made.

Parameters:
username - FTP Username

setUserPassword

void setUserPassword(java.lang.String password)
Sets the password credentials for the connection to be made.

Parameters:
password - FTP credentials

setSSL

void setSSL(java.lang.Boolean enableSSL)
Enables SSL in transfers. False by default.

Parameters:
enableSSL -

setServletLoc

void setServletLoc(java.lang.String servletURL)
Sets the servlet location for the server. http://:12480/servlet/ftpservlet ie: http://127.0.0.1:12480/servlet/ftpservlet

Parameters:
servlet - location URL

addFilenamesForRename

void addFilenamesForRename(java.lang.String filenames,
                           java.lang.String delimiter)
Specify a list of filenames to which the transferred files will be renamed. The number of filenames specified must match the number of files added to the queue or no renames will be performed. Values may be absolute paths, relative paths, or just filenames.

For Example:

5 files have been added to the upload queue using the following: 
document.filecatalyst.addFilesToQueue("c:/temp/file1.txt,c:/temp/file2.txt,c:/temp/file3.txt,c:/temp/file4.txt,c:/temp/file5.txt",",");
To rename those files on download, prior to calling uploadLive(), the following call could be made: 
document.filecatalyst.addFilenamesForRename("renamefile1.txt,renamefile2.txt,renamefile3.txt,renamefile4.txt,renamefile5.txt",",");
The 5 files will be uploaded to the server, and renamed on the fly to the filenames specified in the call to addFilenamesForRename().

Parameters:
filenames - String delimited list of filenames
delimiter - String Delimiter to use when parsing list of filenames

addFileToQueueWithRename

void addFileToQueueWithRename(java.lang.String file,
                              java.lang.String newFilename)
Adds the specified file to the transfer queue, and also specifies that it should be renamed to the specified new filename when it is downloaded. Value for newFilename may be an absolute path, a relative path, or just a filename.

For Example:

If you made the following call: 
document.filecatalyst.addFileToQueueWithRename("c:/temp/file1.txt","createdir/renamefile.txt")
And assuming remote working directory on the server was /test (set via setRemoteDir() or remotedir parameter), then file1.txt will be uploaded to /test/createdir/renamefile.txt

Parameters:
file - The file to upload
newFilename - the new name for the file when uploaded

setLocalDir

void setLocalDir(java.lang.String path)
Sets the initial directory for browseLive() method. Equivalent to JS parameter "localDir" Special values may also be input: for Windows clients: MYDOCS places the file chooser on "My Documents" DESKTOP places the file chooser on "Desktop" NETHOOD places the file chooser on "Network Neighborhood" or equivalent for all clients: HOME places the file chooser on the user's home directory

Parameters:
path -

getLocalDir

java.lang.String getLocalDir()
Returns the current path set for local directory.

Returns:
path set for localDir

setRememberBrowseLocation

void setRememberBrowseLocation(boolean value)
Sets the JS parameter "rememberBrowseLocation". Allows the browseLive() to save the last path selected into the localDir, so next browseLive() call will re-launch the file chooser to the same user selected directory. Application default is false.

Parameters:
value -

runAutoDetect

void runAutoDetect()
Initiates the auto-detect sequence, and automatically updates transfer mode

Since:
3.0.1 build 5

checkPermissions

boolean checkPermissions()
Method can be called to see if the applet has required permissions to properly transfer files

Returns:
true if applet has proper permissions to transfer files.
Since:
3.0.1 build 5
